intro: Erythroxylum dubium, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped berries that are typically red when mature. It is known for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive. The species is also related to the coca plant, sharing similar chemical properties.
